org.greatage.ioc
Interface ServiceLocator

All Known Implementing Classes:
ServiceLocatorImpl
public interface ServiceLocator

This class represents object which can provide access to services by their id, or (when appropriate) by just service interface. It is an entry point to Great Age IoC container.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Ivan Khalopik

Method Summary

Method Detail

getServiceIds

java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getServiceIds()
Gets all service ids provided by this service locator.

Returns:
all service ids or empty set

getServiceStatus

ServiceStatus<?> getServiceStatus(java.lang.String id)
Gets service status by specified service id.

Parameters:
id - unique service id
Returns:
service status or null if not found

getService

<T> T getService(java.lang.String id,
                 java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass)
Gets a service instance by specified service id. It returns the service's proxy that implements the same interface as the actual service and instantiates the actual service only as needed with all configured method advices.

Type Parameters:
T - service type
Parameters:
id - unique service id, case is sensitive
serviceClass - service interface
Returns:
service instance that implement specified service interface
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if the service is not found, or if an error occurs instantiating it

getService

<T> T getService(java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass)
Gets a service instance by its service interface. It returns the service's proxy that implements the same interface as the actual service and instantiates the actual service only as needed with all configured method advices.

Type Parameters:
T - service type
Parameters:
serviceClass - service interface
Returns:
service instance that implement specified service interface
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if there are no ore more than one services found, or if an error occurs instantiating it

findServices

<T> java.util.Set<T> findServices(java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass)
Retrieves services by their service interface. It returns the service's proxies that implements the same interface as the actual service and instantiates the actual service only as needed with all configured method advices.

Type Parameters:
T - service type
Parameters:
serviceClass - service interface
Returns:
services that implement specified service interface or empty set
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if an error occurs instantiating it
